name: Gothic Quarter Free Walking Tour (Available in English)
shortDescription:
On the Gothic tour, come and have an overview of 2000 years of Catalan history, art, architecture, culture, legends, music, food from the 1st century Roman fort to the 1992 Summer Olympics and its influence on modern Barcelona. Along the narrow, windy streets we'll visit: * La Rambla * The Cathedral * Jewish quarter * Christian Saints and Martyrs * Christopher Columbus * The medieval hangman * Picasso and a very hairy Catalan man! Oh yes, and the best chocolate and Churros in the city centre!

Booking not required for children under 18.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Gaudí & Modernism- a Story! (Available in English)
description:
If you just want FACTS, FACTS, FACTS, FACTS, FACTS, FACTS, FACTS, then sorry this tour is NOT for you. Of course, there will be facts:
Antoní Gaudí - Born June 25, 1852
Height of the Sagrada Familia Towers: 172m
And facts are important! But never let the facts get in the way of a good story…!
The story of Gaudí and Modernisme.

A story that starts in the 19th century. A story of industrial change; a city's expansion; new, revolutionary political philosophies; a new artistic movement; and the life of it's greatest architectural giant - Antoni Gaudí

We delve into Modernism's themes and how they were shown on their buildings: the Casa Battló, Casa Milá, and other houses as well. How the social, cultural and political forces literally shaped the physical appearances of these stunning buildings. But, before it gets too heavy, we'll also see stories of flamboyant, on the make property developers; tobacco planters on ego trips; a surgeon with a (possible) inferiority complex; families outdoing each other ( no change there, then!); and dragons. Lots of dragons!

You'll hear of Gaudí: his personality,habits, ideas, methods, and…. what he had for lunch!
Then after a short 1 metro journey, we'll arrive at his unfinished masterpiece, the Sagrada Familia, with an explanation of this unique, beguiling church!
So, on the Gaudí and Modernism: a Story! tour, as a professional actor I  will try and weave my story telling skills with my passion for history, the serious and the humourous,  connecting all these strands together and hopefully connecting you as well to this phenomenal time.

But don't just take my word for it, ( I'm bound to big myself up!) Check out the reviews below. Maybe they will help you decide. Thanks and hopefully see you on the tour. Patrick

Children under 18 do not need a reservation

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Tour Barcelona in full. (Available in Spanish)
shortDescription:
Barcelona and its wonders.
 This tour is an aperitif of everything that this wonderful city has to offer. We will walk through emblematic places, monuments hidden in the routine life of the people of Barcelona since the settlement of the first settlers, passing through Romans, Catholic kings, Jaime I, the Indians, modernists like Gaudí ... even basilicas that have been protagonists of some recognized novels and tragic moments like the Civil War.
Why is this Free Tour different?
 Because I like to tell stories and discover little things that make great things different or even unique.
 Our tour begins in Plaza Catalunya , the meeting point not only for travelers like you but also for many locals. We would go down the Ramblas discovering its small and great wonders and anecdotes ( Canaletas, Palacio de la Virreina, Mercado de la Boquería , ..), by the way, some a bit bloody, like in the Liceo Theater .
We would turn until we reached Plaza del Rey , we would go up to Plaza Sant Jaume. With great care and going backwards we would reach the Cathedral , yes, before passing through the Church of Felip Neri.
Before going down Via Laietana and passing in front of part of the Roman wall , what is that sea of colors? The Santa Caterina market.
On the way to the Basilica del Mar , how about a stop at the oldest candy store in Barcelona?
We would end up at Plaza Palacio from where a brief description of the Barceloneta and Maremagnum neighborhoods would be made.
Dare to know a modern city, with a lot of history that will catch you and will make you come back one more time.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Tour 'Barcelona and Barça' (Available in Spanish)
shortDescription:
Bstadium has exclusively designed a surprising themed free tour of Barcelona for lovers of FC Barcelona and football in general. Walk through the most emblematic places and discover the most surprising stories linked to the main clubs in Barcelona.

From the hand of a specialized guide who will reveal fascinating anecdotes and stories related to football and sports, you will get to know Barcelona in a totally original way.

The route will begin at 11 am in Plaça Catalunya , a strategic point in the city and the border area between the Old Town and its expansion (Eixample). Once the history that permeates the square has been explained, we will enter the Ciutat Vella district through the Rambla where we will find the Canaletas Fountain, a place where the Blaugrana fans celebrate.

We will go down to fully enter the incredible Gothic Quarter , more specifically in the Roman Necropolis. Here we will learn about the Roman origin of the city and then arrive at the old Solé Gymnasium , where Joan Gamper and 11 other people founded the Barcelona Football Club.

Continuing through the Raval, we will enter the most visited market in the Catalan capital, the Boquería Market , another fascinating example of Modernism with more than 300 stalls offering all kinds of typical Barcelona gastronomy products. Leaving through the main entrance on La Rambla, we will find the lottery office founded by a former FC Barcelona player.

We will advance along La Rambla and the Gothic Quarter to admire buildings of great importance in the city such as the Teatro del Liceu, the Basilica of Santa María del Pi and even the Can Culleretes restaurant, which has a great football history.

To end this surprising tour, we will visit Plaza Sant Jaume , a political and popular square where the Town Hall and the Generalitat are located on both sides, from whose balcony the players and managers offered the cup to their followers.

At the end of the tour , all attendees will be offered by Bstadium an exclusive discount that they can redeem in any of the available experiences.

Surprise your family and friends with this original tour!

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: BARCINO: the origin of Barcelona (Available in Spanish)
shortDescription:
We invite you to discover the origins of Barcelona, ​​with sites of the ancient Roman Barcino, the art of the artists Pablo Picasso, Joan Miró and also the greatest representative of Catalan modernist architecture Antoni Gaudi. The itinerary starts from Plaza de la Vila in Madrid with the Via Sepulcral Romana, we will take a photo in the beso mural, we will observe the Friso or Picasso's mural, we will visit the Cathedral of Barcelona, ​​we will visit we cross the Roman walls to enter the Temple of Augustus, we will continue through the Jewish quarter - the Great Synagogue of Barcelona, ​​then through Plaza San Felipe Neri and we will end up at the Porta del Mar. Please note that we may change the route a little according to the weather and the abilities of the group or according to your preferences, because we want this experience to be special. Do you want to see something in particular? Write to us and we will prepare a personalized tour. ** OPTIONAL ** On Thursday we will go for a bite to eat at one of our favorite places on Blai Street, where there will be small sandwiches, tapas and tapas on the terrace and a fun atmosphere. Duration: about 2 hours ** Comfortable clothing and shoes ** ** IMPORTANT ** Minimum booking of 2 people, it is recommended to book 1 day in advance. YOU WANT TO LEARN IT AND PASS IT WELL !!!

name: Discover Barcelona, a City with Charm! - Free Walking Tour (Available in English, Spanish, French)
shortDescription:
What will you discover? The most entertaining visit of the city! Our meeting point will be Plaza Catalunya and from there we will move towards Las Ramblas, a picturesque and full of life boulevard, that joins Plaza Catalunya with the Columbus monument that is located in the Port of Barcelona. We will pass by the Boqueria Market, the oldest and most famous market in this city, which has more than 200 stalls where you can buy handicrafts of all kinds. You will see there bars and restaurants where both residents and tourists enjoy of a colorful and full of flavors atmosphere. We will pass through the Gothic Quarter, the basilica of Santa María del Pi, the Cathedral and then reaching the street of Bisbe, we will see the Generalitat and the City Hall of Barcelona. Walking down Montcada street we arrive at the Picasso Museum. In Born, there are many places where you can do all kinds of shopping. Paseo del Born will take us to the Ciutadella Park which was the first public park in Barcelona. Our tour ends at the Maremagnum, a busy leisure site where if you have time you can enjoy other activities and places like The Aquarium of Barcelona. I hope to hear from you very soon!

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Alternative Tour: the other side of Barcelona. (Available in English, Spanish)
description:
Book now the Best Raval tour in town!

Some people say that the neighborhood of the Raval is the neighborhood of the prostitution, the drugs and the poverty.

This is so reductive.

So much so that it is an insult to the Raval and its inhabitants.
The Raval is first and foremost a "barrio obrero", a blue collar neighborhood.

It is the district where the industrial revolution started in Spain in 1832, where people demanded justice, respect and fought for it. It is the district of the work day of eight hours and no more fifteen, of the strikes and the riots,of the solidarity between the people.

The Raval is the birthplace of the anarchism and the syndicalism in the country.

Did you know that Barcelona had been ruled by the anarchists at some point at the start of the civil war for ten months ?

Did you know that our wonderful city had two nicknames, the "Rose of  fire" and the "City of the bombs" ?

Join us to discover the alternative side of the city, not the pretty, the glamorous but where normal people live and keep on resisting nowadays. Feel the essence, the soul of Barcelona.
We are gonna talk about the Raval today, the most diverse and multicultural neighborhood of the city, 66% of its population was not born in Spain.

It is also one of the hotspot of the street art in town and its street sometimes look like an open air museum.

This won't be your usual walking tour.
We are gonna show you the good,the bad and the ugly.

An heritage the city can be proud of, humble people demanding justice and refusing to take no for an answer.
The Raval is also the home of the oldest Bar in town that has been open for 221 years, a wonderful market "la Boqueria" and many very amazing architectural treasures  that you will surely be happy to have discovered.
We are waiting for you and the Raval is too!

See you soon !

In this tour you'll see:

- Anarchist movement in Barcelona
- MACBA
- Plaza Real
- Palau Güell
- Street Art
- Botero's Fat Cat
- Absinth Bars
- Vampire of el Raval
- Keith Harring´s mural
- Medieval Hospital of the Saint Cross
- And much more!


Reserve now your spot, we have limited places!

**IMPORTANT**
°Reserve now! This is a very popular tour and we have limited places!
°Look for the PINK Umbrella!
°From the 1st of march 2023 the tour will be with radioguides. This will have a coat of 1€ per person.
 °If you're a group of more than 6 persons, even in different bookings you will need to pay the guide a minimum of 10€ per person before the tour starts.

name: Barcelona Renaissance: a free tour of Modernism and Gaudí (Available in )
description:
The end of the XIX and the beginning of the XX century is an extremely significant period for the city of Barcelona. An unparalleled economic growth, feed by huge profits made in the Spanish colonies of America, is changing the “Condal” city landscape.
An early industrial revolution places Barcelona at the helm of Spanish economy. A new “romantic” cultural movement called Renaixença inspired by the Catalan traditions, history and language, produces a huge artistic output that would have its pivotal expression in the work of three genial architects: Louís Domènec i Montaner, Josep Puig i Cadafalch and Antoni Gaudí.

The tour will be divided in two parts: in the first hour, we will be visiting the Passeig the Gracia, the most luxurious and sophisticated street in the catalan Capital. We will learn about life in the city at the turn of the last century and will unravel all the secrets of the most amazing houses of the so called block of the discord.
Then, after a short metro ride, we will marvel at one of the most amazing work of art ever produced, the majestic and breathtaking “basilica de la Sagrada Familia”.
This outstanding (but still unfinished) masterpiece is a bible in stone, a song of eternal prise sculptured in the rock.
Groundbreaking in its design and rich of hidden symbolism, it offers to million visitors every year a unique spiritual and emotional experience.

This Modernism tour is essential to better appreciate those artistic works and also to have a better understanding of what is Barcelona and Catalonia today.

NB: In order to reach the Sagrada Familia, we will be taking a quick Metro journey. Make sure you have a ticket or let us know whether you need one at the start of the tour.

Itinerary:

  • Plaça Catalunya
  • The Eixample
  • The panots of Barcelona. The street tiles.
  • Modernism and Renaixença
  • Passeig de Gracia
  • Casa Antoni Rocamona
  • Las Farolas bancos del Paseo de Gracia
  • The legend of the bat
  • El National
  • Boutique Rolex, former Bar Torino
  • Casa Maladriga
  • La Manzana della Discordia
  • Casa Lele Moreira
  • Casa Amatller
  • Casa Battlò
  • Casa Millà “La Pedrera”
  • Casa Ramon Casas
  • La Sagrada Familia

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: El Raval - Myths and Legends of a Hidden History in Barcelona (Available in Spanish)
description:
Every city has that place, that space, where it turns invisible everything that bothers it and disturbs it. This is the case of Raval, a neighborhood that since its inception has a history of marginalization and exclusion. But like everything that wants to be silenced and hidden, the Raval shouts, shouts in favor of integration and art. I invite you to discover the stories, legends, myths and iconic places of one of the richest neighborhoods in the world in culture and diversity. In this tour we will visit: - Canaletes fountain. - Macba and CCCB. - House of Enriqueta Martí (vampire of the raval). - Former Hospital of the Santa Creu. - La Boqueria Market. - Liceu Theater. - Palau Güell. - Marseille Bar. - Rambla del Raval.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Barcelona's Old City Free Walking Tour (Available in English, Spanish)
description:
Barcelona has one of the best preserved historical centers in Europe. The sea, the climate, the Mediterranean cuisine and its lifestyle make Barcelona a unique city. Discover it with us by exploring the streets designed by the Romans more than 2,000 years ago and traveling through time from the Middle Ages to the present day. In this tour we will surprise you with stories, legends and secrets of warriors, invaders, explorers, kings and queens, great painters like Miró, Dalí, Picasso and architects like the great Gaudí. Each and every one of them being protagonists in the construction of this magnificent city. We will not only talk about its history but, nowadays the cuisine and its nightlife also reach the category of art. Discover the best places to eat, drink and listen to the best live music. Book now!

name: Gaudí & Modernism Tour (Available in English)
description:
Come on a journey through late 19th/early 20th century upmarket Barcelona, to see the life and works of Catalunya’s architectural genius Antoni Gaudí and his contemporaries.

Explore the social, cultural and political forces that literally shaped the physical appearances of these stunning buildings. Fancy houses of rich industrialists, merchants and chocolatiers with their astonishing details, flamboyant decoration that hide the secrets and amazing stories of their powerful owners. But you´ll also hear of legends, the clashing of social classes and an understanding of Gaudí, his methods, ideas and personality.

At the end, finish with an  explanation of Gaudí’s unfinished masterpiece, the Sagrada Familia, a unique church famous all over the world as the symbol of Barcelona. 



 POINTS WE WILL SEE

 - Catalonian square

 - Paseo de Gracia

 - Palau Malagrida

 - Lleó i Morera House

 - Casa Amatller

 - Casa Batlló

 - Casa Mila

 - Sagrada Familia


Exclusive is better! that's why your  local guide will go out with the “Safety and Health Recommendation” and “Small Groups”, 


This allows us to adjust the tour contents to meet your specific interests, providing real quality-time with guide and guests, And because the number of participants on this tour will be limited,  we ask you to book only if you are sure that you will attend the tour and, if not, it gives us a chance to show another visitor our city.

There is 1 short metro journey of 2 stops to the Sagrada Familia.

name: The street Raval (Available in Spanish)
description:
El Raval has been since ancient times the neighborhood where newcomers settled, all those without citizenship status who could not shelter within the protection of the walls. Port and worker neighborhood, rogue and industrious, cozy and untamed, bright and unhealthy.

The Raval has always had its own vitality, rich and uncontrollable, in constant change. Headquarters of the Boquería and Sant Antoni markets, the Chinatown, the Santa Creu gothic hospital, the Reina Amalia prison, theaters and cabarets and the gypsy quarter. Filled in times of factories and soot, an anarchist nursery and a stronghold of the labor movement. The heart of Barcelona, a neighborhood without which this city could not be explained. Come and meet it from the hand of someone who has grown up in its streets.

POINTS WE WILL SEE:

- Catalonian square

- Fonte das Canaletas

- CCCB - Contemporary Cultural Center of Barcelona

- Rosa del Foc - Anarchist Bookstore.


- Boadas Bar

- MACBA

- Rambla del Raval

- Library of Barcelona

- Teatre Romea

- Gardens of Rubió i Lluch

- La Boqueria

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Discovering Modernista Barcelona (Available in English, Spanish)
description:
About the Tour

Barcelona is several cities in one, small stories that make us fall in love, teachings of the time, marked on its walls.

An artist can be defined as someone who understands his context and expresses it, immortalizing it in time. That is exactly what the modernist architects were in Barcelona, artists who invite us to discover the secrets they left captured on walls, rooftops, and lampposts.

We will visit:

Plaza Catalunya.
Passeig de Gracia.
The apple of discord (Casa Lleó i Morera).
Amatller House
Batlló House.
Casa Milà (La Pedrera).
Sagrada Familia.

Note:

- The tour involves transfer by subway.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: The Spanish Civil War and Franco's dictatorship (Available in English)
description:
Free walking tour Spanish Civil War Barcelona

Stroll through the streets, squares and neighborhoods where the Spanish Civil War took place in Barcelona.

On this 2-hour tour you will understand this incredibly important conflict that led to a 36-year fascist dictatorship and would change Spain forever.

What will we talk about

  • Why and how did the war start?
  • Who were the many different groups fighting each other?
  • The anarchist communist movement during the Spanish Civil War
  • What was it like to live under Franco's dictatorship?
  • How did the war and the dictatorship end?
  • The roles of women before, during and after the war

What you will see

  • Little damage remaining from battles and bombardments in Barcelona
  • Neighborhoods where much of the fighting took place
  • Sites from George Orwell's book "Homage to Catalonia"


By the end of this tour you will know why beautiful Barcelona was known as the most explosive and revolutionary city in Europe.

Perfect Civil War Tour of Barcelona for history buffs, students, schools and school trips.

The complicated story is made accessible through clear narration and with the help of historical images of the period.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Old Town, the first Barcelonas- Free Tour (Available in Catalan, Spanish)
description:
Contact as an aperitif, to learn more about this wonderful Mediterranean city.
We will begin the tour of the two Barcelonas that are still recognizable and that underlie this wonderful city. We will start from the Rambla , where we will frame the physical space of the two cities, the Roman and the medieval , to show, between anecdotes and legends, one of the most important Roman necropolises in Europe.
We will be able to see the cathedral and some buildings close to the Roman wall as well as part of that Gothic city , which holds some surprises.
We will visit the Roman temple of Augustus , practically hidden in the city, the Plaza Sant Jaume , center of power in the course of these 2000 years of history, we will also try to condense and make understandable, 800 years of architecture and history in the Plaza del Rei , We will also talk about the city's Jewish past , ending with the thousand-year-old Iglesia del Pi and its surroundings, such as the Fivaller Palace.

The main points of interest of the visit will be:

  • the boulevard
  • roman necropolis
  • Santa Anna Fountain
  • Fontcuberta Mosaic
  • Plaza Nova and Roman wall
  • St. Lucia
  • Ardiaca House
  • Sant Felipe Neri Square
  • Pla de la Seu (facade)
  • King's Square
  • Paradis and Freneria streets
  • Sant Jaume square
  • call jewish
  • Plaza del Pi (Rosette, Palau Fivaller)

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free tour Gothic Quarter: Travel in time. (Available in English, Spanish)
description:
Free Tour through the Gothic Quarter , starting at La Rambla , a place that marks the entrance to the Ciutat Vella and the old walled city of Barcelona . Learn the story behind every corner of this amazing neighborhood. More than 2000 years of history lie in this place, with great buildings, amazing streets and a melting pot of cultures. The Gothic Quarter is well known as it is the birthplace of modern Barcelona, ​​this neighborhood is a must see.
In our tour we will tell you about:

  • The Rambla
  • Canaletes Fountain
  • roman necropolis
  • Entrance to Barcino and Roman wall
  • Barcelona Cathedral
  • Plaça de Sant Felip Neri
  • Bisbe Bridge
  • King's Square
  • And much more…


KIDS AND TEENAGERS DO NOT NEED A RESERVATION (up to 18y.o.).
CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS DO NOT NEED A RESERVATION.

Find us every day at the top of La Rambla , right next to Plaça Catalunya and in front of Café Zurich (Plaça Catalunya 1) at 11:00 a.m. Look for the WHITE umbrella!

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Art Play + Sagrada Familia (Gaudí and more) Free tour (Available in Spanish)
description:
THE BEST walking tour to see and understand the Barcelona we have today. Discover the stories and legends involving modernist masterpieces, how a new architectural style has defined the personality and identity of our city. Artists who have become famous all over the world such as Gaudí, Pablo Picasso, Josep Llimona and many others. We will walk through Passeig de Gracia, a must to visit Barcelona and end up in the most important place in Barcelona, the Sagrada Família! Children and teenagers (up to 18 years) do not need a reservation. To get to the Sagrada Família we will use the metro, so you need 1 ticket, if you don't have a metro ticket we will give you assistance on how to get one.
